intro: Pelargonium rubidum, commonly known as the red geranium, is a species of flowering plant in the family Geraniaceae. It is native to South Africa and is characterized by its vibrant red flowers and rounded leaves. The plant typically grows to a height of about 30–60 cm and thrives in full sun to partial shade. Its flowers bloom in clusters and are often used in gardens for their ornamental value. Pelargonium rubidum is relatively low maintenance and prefers well-drained soil.
